channel.title: All the tech news (Posts about gitlab-blog)

item.title: Fine-grained permissions for job tokens is now GA
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ GitLab 18.3 has launched fine-grained permissions for job tokens, now in GA! This update enhances security by allowing maintainers to set specific permissions for job tokens, following the principle of least privilege. üîí Key resources include Repositories, Deployments, and Pipelines, with more API endpoints planned for future releases. This capability aims to reduce security risks in CI/CD pipelines. üë• DevOps teams should assess this opt-in feature for projects with automated deployments‚Ä¶.

Source: GitLab Blog
Author: Joe Randazzo
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Custom admin roles are now GA
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ GitLab has rolled out custom admin roles for Self-Managed and Dedicated instances! These roles enable organizations to apply granular permissions, ensuring the principle of least privilege is upheld while enhancing operational efficiency. Key features include centralized management, LDAP integration, and purpose-built roles for various teams. This aligns with GitLab‚Äôs mission to boost software supply chain security. For more details, check out the custom roles documentation. #GitLab‚Ä¶

Source: GitLab Blog
Author: Joe Randazzo
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Embedded views: The future of work tracking in GitLab
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üìä Tired of switching tabs in GitLab to track your projects? Introducing Embedded Views! This feature, available in version 18.3, allows you to access live, relevant data directly within your workflow. No more outdated reports or endless context switching. With GitLab Query Language (GLQL), you can pull real-time data right where you need it, enhancing collaboration and maintaining context. Learn how this can transform your team‚Äôs work tracking! üöÄ #GitLab #ProjectManagement‚Ä¶

Source: GitLab Blog
Author: Alex Fracazo
Category: product_announcements

item.title: GitLab 18.3: Expanding AI orchestration in software engineering
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ GitLab 18.3 is here, enhancing software engineering with integrated AI capabilities! The platform now serves as a comprehensive system of record, control plane, and user experience hub. Key updates include a Knowledge Graph for better data context, an Orchestration Layer for multi-agent workflows, and first-class agent integration across the development lifecycle. This evolution promotes seamless human-AI collaboration, boosting productivity for over 50 million users. Explore the future of‚Ä¶

Source: GitLab Blog
Author: Bill Staples
Category: product_announcements

item.title: The GitLab documentation site gets a major design overhaul
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ The GitLab documentation site has undergone a major redesign! Key updates include: üåô Dark mode for improved readability. üé® Enhanced brand alignment with GitLab‚Äôs marketing site. üëç Simplified feedback options with thumbs up/down directly on pages. üìö Redesigned navigation for easier access to over 2,300 pages. üîß Addressed technical debt for a more polished experience. These changes stem from a recent platform migration, enhancing overall performance. #GitLab #Documentation #UXDesign‚Ä¶

Source: GitLab Blog
Author: Julia Miocene
Category: product_announcements

item.title: What‚Äôs new in Git 2.51.0?
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Git has released version 2.51, with key updates aimed at improving performance and user experience. üîß Notable changes include enhanced git-push(1) and git-fetch(1) commands, which now use batched updates for reference synchronization, resulting in up to 22x speed improvements. üì¶ The release also introduces the ‚Äúreftable‚Äù format as the default reference backend, addressing limitations of the previous ‚Äúfiles‚Äù backend. üîë Additionally, SHA-256 is now the default hash function, enhancing‚Ä¶

Source: GitLab Blog
Author: Karthik Nayak
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Why financial services choose single-tenant SaaS
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Financial institutions face unique challenges with shared infrastructure, which heightens systemic risks. As highlighted by JPMorgan Chase‚Äôs CISO, incidents on multi-tenant platforms can lead to widespread disruptions. GitLab Dedicated offers a solution, providing isolated environments for development while ensuring compliance and security. This approach enables institutions to manage risks more effectively, ensuring their source code is treated as a critical asset. Learn more about how‚Ä¶

Source: GitLab Blog
Author: Allie Holland
Category: security_compliance

item.title: Custom rules in GitLab Duo Agentic Chat for greater developer efficiency
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Unlock the potential of GitLab Duo with custom rules to enhance developer efficiency! üöÄ Transform your AI assistant into a tailored coding expert. Set version controls for Java, enforce coding styles, and automate DevSecOps processes. This guide covers practical steps, use cases, and examples to streamline your coding standards. Explore how to implement custom rules in GitLab projects today! #GitLab #DeveloperEfficiency #CustomRules #DevSecOps #AIInDevelopment

Source: GitLab Blog
Author: Michael Friedrich
Category: educational

item.title: Get started with GitLab Duo Agentic Chat in the web UI
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ GitLab has introduced the Duo Agentic Chat feature, enhancing user interaction with the GitLab API directly from the web UI. This tool allows users to manage issues, track statuses, and take actions based on conversations. Access is available for Duo Pro or Enterprise users, streamlining workflows across projects. To start, navigate to your Group or Project, open the chat panel, and toggle to Agentic mode. Explore how Agentic Chat can simplify your development tasks! #GitLab #DuoAgenticChat‚Ä¶

Source: GitLab Blog
Author: Daniel Helfand
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Own your AI: Self-Hosted GitLab Duo models with AWS Bedrock

item.description:

For detailed guidance, check out the full article! üìäüîê #AI #GitLab #DataPrivacy #AWS #SoftwareDevelopment
